## Classes

### <a name="abide"></a>`abide`

abide provides a user-friendly interface for applying compliance
benchmark classes. Configuration should be driven by Hiera, but
you can also use class params to configure how a benchmark is
applied to the system.

#### Examples

##### Using defaults (CIS server level 1 benchmark)

```puppet
include abide
```

##### Specifying a benchmark config

```puppet
class { 'abide':
  benchmark => 'cis',
  config    => {
    'level' => '1',
    'profile' => 'server',
    'ignore' => ['1.1.1.1', '1.1.1.3'],
    'control_configs' => {
      'ensure_tmp_is_configured' => {
        'noexec' => true,
      },
    },
  },
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide` class:

* [`benchmark`](#benchmark)
* [`config`](#config)

##### <a name="benchmark"></a>`benchmark`

Data type: `Enum['cis']`

The compliance benchmark you would like to enforce.

Default value: `'cis'`

##### <a name="config"></a>`config`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A configuration hash for the chosen benchmark. See docs for more details.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abidebenchmarkscis"></a>`abide::benchmarks::cis`

Provides an OS-independent interface for the CIS benchmark profile

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide::benchmarks::cis
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide::benchmarks::cis` class:

* [`profile`](#profile)
* [`level`](#level)
* [`include_dil`](#include_dil)
* [`only`](#only)
* [`ignore`](#ignore)
* [`preferred_exclusives`](#preferred_exclusives)
* [`control_configs`](#control_configs)

##### <a name="profile"></a>`profile`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['server', 'workstation']]`

Which benchmark profile you would like to enforce.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="level"></a>`level`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['1', '2']]`

Which CIS benchmark level to enforce.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="include_dil"></a>`include_dil`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether or not to include the distribution-independent
linux benchmark as well as the OS-specific benchmark.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="only"></a>`only`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Only enforce these rules. Takes precedence over $ignore.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="ignore"></a>`ignore`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Ignore enforcement on these rules. Mutually exclusive with $only.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="preferred_exclusives"></a>`preferred_exclusives`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Some controls are mutually exclusive. This parameter contains names
of the preferred controls to enforce in the event that multiple,
mutually exclusive controls would be enforced. If there are many
controls that are mutually exclusive that fall under one section,
such as the firewall configs section, only the first control needs
to be specified as the other controls are considered children
and will automatically be excluded as well.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="control_configs"></a>`control_configs`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

Override default configured values of a control. See docs for more info.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsbootloadergrub2_permissions"></a>`abide_linux::utils::bootloader::grub2_permissions`

Ensures that /boot/grub2/grub.cfg and /boot/grub2/user.cfg are
owned by root:root and have 0600 permissions. It will NOT
create the grub2 bootloader files if they do not exist.

### <a name="abideutilsfirewallfirewalld"></a>`abide_linux::utils::firewall::firewalld`

Provides a wrapper for puppet/firewalld that exposes most options.
Additionally, will remove iptables-services and remove / mask
nfltables base on parameter input.

lint:ignore:140chars
lint:endignore

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::firewall::firewalld
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::firewall::firewalld` class:

* [`ensure_package`](#ensure_package)
* [`ensure_iptables_package`](#ensure_iptables_package)
* [`merge_defaults`](#merge_defaults)
* [`purge_iptables_services`](#purge_iptables_services)
* [`purge_nftables`](#purge_nftables)
* [`default_zone`](#default_zone)
* [`zones`](#zones)
* [`ports`](#ports)
* [`services`](#services)
* [`rich_rules`](#rich_rules)
* [`custom_services`](#custom_services)
* [`ipsets`](#ipsets)
* [`direct_rules`](#direct_rules)
* [`direct_chains`](#direct_chains)
* [`direct_passthroughs`](#direct_passthroughs)
* [`purge_direct_rules`](#purge_direct_rules)
* [`purge_direct_chains`](#purge_direct_chains)
* [`purge_direct_passthroughs`](#purge_direct_passthroughs)
* [`purge_unknown_ipsets`](#purge_unknown_ipsets)
* [`log_denied`](#log_denied)
* [`cleanup_on_exit`](#cleanup_on_exit)
* [`zone_drifting`](#zone_drifting)
* [`minimal_mark`](#minimal_mark)
* [`lockdown`](#lockdown)
* [`ipv6_rpfilter`](#ipv6_rpfilter)
* [`default_service_zone`](#default_service_zone)
* [`default_port_zone`](#default_port_zone)
* [`default_port_protocol`](#default_port_protocol)

##### <a name="ensure_package"></a>`ensure_package`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['present', 'installed', 'latest']]`

Ensure for the firewalld package resource. Default: `installed`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="ensure_iptables_package"></a>`ensure_iptables_package`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['present', 'installed', 'latest']]`

Ensure for the iptables package resource. Default: `installed`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="merge_defaults"></a>`merge_defaults`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

If true, will merge user-specified parameters with class defaults, where
appropriate. This affects the $ports parameter because this class
specifies to open ports in the default settings, 22 and 8140, that are
required for SSH and Puppet agent communication, respectively. These
two port statements do not need to be redeclared if you have this
parameter set to true. Default: `true`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="purge_iptables_services"></a>`purge_iptables_services`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

When true, removes the package `iptables-services`. Default: `true`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="purge_nftables"></a>`purge_nftables`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

When true, removes the package `nftables`. If set to false, the
nftables service is stopped and masked instead.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="default_zone"></a>`default_zone`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Sets the default firewalld zone to this zone. Default: `public`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="zones"></a>`zones`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of firewalld zones to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="ports"></a>`ports`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of port configurations.
Default: `{ 'Open port tcp/22 on default zone (SSH)' => { 'ensure' => 'present', 'port' => 22, 'protocol' => 'tcp' }, 'Open port tcp/8140 on default zone (Puppet Agent)' => { 'ensure' => 'present', 'port' => 8140, 'protocol' => 'tcp' } }`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="services"></a>`services`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of services to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="rich_rules"></a>`rich_rules`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of rich firewall rules to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="custom_services"></a>`custom_services`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of custom firewall services to create. This parameter is
deprecated in puppet/firewalld and should not be used, but is
exposed here for posterity. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="ipsets"></a>`ipsets`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of ipsets to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="direct_rules"></a>`direct_rules`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of direct rules to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="direct_chains"></a>`direct_chains`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of direct chains to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="direct_passthroughs"></a>`direct_passthroughs`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of direct passthroughs to create. Default: `{}`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="purge_direct_rules"></a>`purge_direct_rules`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

If true, will purge all direct rules not managed by this class.
Default: `false`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="purge_direct_chains"></a>`purge_direct_chains`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

If true, will purge all direct chains not managed by this class.
Default: `false`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="purge_direct_passthroughs"></a>`purge_direct_passthroughs`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

If true, will purge all direct passthroughs not managed by this class.
Default: `false`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="purge_unknown_ipsets"></a>`purge_unknown_ipsets`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

If true, will purge all ipsets not managed by this class.
Default: `false`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="log_denied"></a>`log_denied`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['off', 'all', 'unicast', 'broadcast', 'multicast']]`

Set type of denied packets to log

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="cleanup_on_exit"></a>`cleanup_on_exit`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['yes', 'no']]`

Whether or not to clean up firewalld config on exit or stop of firewalld

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="zone_drifting"></a>`zone_drifting`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['yes', 'no']]`

Whether or not to allow zone drifting

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="minimal_mark"></a>`minimal_mark`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Marks up to this minimum are free for use

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="lockdown"></a>`lockdown`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['yes', 'no']]`

If yes, firewall changes will be limited to applications in the lockdown whitelist

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="ipv6_rpfilter"></a>`ipv6_rpfilter`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['yes', 'no']]`

If yes, enables reverse path filter test on IPv6 packets

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="default_service_zone"></a>`default_service_zone`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

Sets the default zone for services

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="default_port_zone"></a>`default_port_zone`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

### <a name="abideutilslogindefs"></a>`abide_linux::utils::logindefs`

This class is responsible for setting / managing password
maximum, minimum, and warning ages. All ages are specified
in days. This class can also enforce these rules on current
user accounts with passwords using the `chage` command. Only
user accounts with valid, encrypted passwords in /etc/shadow
will be subject to enforcement via `chage`.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::logindefs
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::logindefs` class:

* [`pass_max_days`](#pass_max_days)
* [`pass_min_days`](#pass_min_days)
* [`pass_warn_age`](#pass_warn_age)
* [`enforce_on_current`](#enforce_on_current)
* [`pass_inactive`](#pass_inactive)

##### <a name="pass_max_days"></a>`pass_max_days`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The maximum time in days that a password is valid.
Default: 365

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="pass_min_days"></a>`pass_min_days`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The minimum time in days that a password in valid.
Configuring this will disable password changes on
passwords younger in days than this setting.
Default: 1

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="pass_warn_age"></a>`pass_warn_age`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

Issues warnings to change password when the password
has this many days left before reaching maximum age.
Default: 7

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="enforce_on_current"></a>`enforce_on_current`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether to enforce these password rules on accounts
with encrypted passwords in /etc/shadow.
Default: true

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="pass_inactive"></a>`pass_inactive`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`



Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsmotd"></a>`abide_linux::utils::motd`

This class configures a system message of the day on a wide variety of systems.
This class is a pretty direct clone of puppetlabs/puppetlabs-motd. It was
vendored to save from having to add another dependency to the Puppetfile.
The only updates to this class are surrounding parameter handling.

#### Examples

##### Basic usage

```puppet
include motd
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::motd` class:

* [`dynamic_motd`](#dynamic_motd)
* [`template`](#template)
* [`content`](#content)
* [`issue_template`](#issue_template)
* [`issue_content`](#issue_content)
* [`issue_net_template`](#issue_net_template)
* [`issue_net_content`](#issue_net_content)
* [`windows_motd_title`](#windows_motd_title)

##### <a name="dynamic_motd"></a>`dynamic_motd`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Enables or disables dynamic motd on Debian systems.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="template"></a>`template`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a custom template. A template takes precedence over `content`. Valid options:  '/mymodule/mytemplate.erb'.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a static string as the motd content.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="issue_template"></a>`issue_template`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a custom template to process and save to `/etc/issue`. A template takes precedence over `issue_content`.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="issue_content"></a>`issue_content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a static string as the `/etc/issue` content.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="issue_net_template"></a>`issue_net_template`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a custom template to process and save to `/etc/issue.net`. A template takes precedence over `issue_net_content`.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="issue_net_content"></a>`issue_net_content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a static string as the `/etc/issue.net` content.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="windows_motd_title"></a>`windows_motd_title`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Specifies a static string to be used for:
'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\policies\system\legalnoticetext'
and 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\policies\system\legalnoticecaption'
The 'legalnoticetext' registry key is shown before login on a Windows system.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsnetworkdisable_icmp_redirects"></a>`abide_linux::utils::network::disable_icmp_redirects`

Uses sysctl to disable the host from accepting ICMP redirect
messages. This disables the ability for outside hosts to
update the hosts routing table.

* **See also**
  * abide_linux::utils::multi_sysctl

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::network::disable_icmp_redirects
```

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::network::disable_icmp_redirects` class:

* [`target`](#target)
* [`persist`](#persist)
* [`comment`](#comment)

##### <a name="target"></a>`target`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The sysctl file that values will be written to.
Default: `/etc/sysctl.d/10-disable_icmp_redirects.conf`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="persist"></a>`persist`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

If set to false, no values will be persisted to disk. Setting
this to false will cause $target and $comment to be ignored.
Default: `true`

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="comment"></a>`comment`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

A comment to add to add to each setting.
Default: `MANAGED BY PUPPET`

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsnetworkdisable_ipv6"></a>`abide_linux::utils::network::disable_ipv6`

Disables IPv6 support on the host by either setting
sysctl parameters in a file or by editing the grub config.
If you chose to disable IPv6 using grub, you will need to
regenerate the grub config on the host.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::network::disable_ipv6
```

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::network::disable_ipv6` class:

* [`sysctl_d_path`](#sysctl_d_path)
* [`sysctl_file_name`](#sysctl_file_name)
* [`prefix`](#prefix)
* [`sysctl_comment`](#sysctl_comment)
* [`sysctl_prefix`](#sysctl_prefix)

##### <a name="strategy"></a>`strategy`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['sysctl', 'grub']]`

Whether to disable IPv6 with sysctl or in the grub config
Default: sysctl

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="create_sysctl_file"></a>`create_sysctl_file`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether to create a new sysctl file or to use the default config file
Default: true

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="sysctl_conf"></a>`sysctl_conf`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Default: /etc/sysctl.conf

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="sysctl_d_path"></a>`sysctl_d_path`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Path to sysctl.d.
Default: /etc/sysctl.d

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="sysctl_file_name"></a>`sysctl_file_name`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If creating a new file, this is the file name.
Default: disable_ipv6.conf

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="prefix"></a>`prefix`

Data type: `String`

A prefix to add to the created file name.
Default: 10-

##### <a name="sysctl_comment"></a>`sysctl_comment`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

A comment to add to the created file.
Default: MANAGED BY PUPPET

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="sysctl_prefix"></a>`sysctl_prefix`

Data type: `Optional[String]`



Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="manage_config"></a>`manage_config`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether or not to manage /etc/aide.conf.
Default: true

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_purge"></a>`conf_purge`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Setting purge to true means that no default values will be used.
WARNING: You MUST configure ALL CONFIG OPTIONS when using purge
to ensure that AIDE can function.
Default: false

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="run_scheduled"></a>`run_scheduled`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether or not to set AIDE to run on a schedule.
Default: true

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="scheduler"></a>`scheduler`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['systemd', 'cron']]`

Whether to use a systemd timer or cron job to schedule
AIDE scans.
Default: systemd

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="systemd_timer_schedule"></a>`systemd_timer_schedule`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Used as the systemd timer unit file's OnSchedule directive.
Default: '*-*-* 00:00:00'

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_source"></a>`conf_source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Passed directly into a file resource to create the config file.
Default: undef

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_db_dir"></a>`conf_db_dir`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The directory AIDE will use to store the DB.
Default: /var/lib/aide

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_log_dir"></a>`conf_log_dir`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The directory AIDE will use to store the log file.
Default: /var/log/aide

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_verbosity"></a>`conf_verbosity`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

How verbose AIDE is in logging. Default: 5

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_report_urls"></a>`conf_report_urls`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Where AIDE should send check results.
Default: [ 'file:@@{LOGDIR}/aide.log', 'stdout' ]

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_rules"></a>`conf_rules`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Custom rule definitions for the AIDE config file. Each item is
passed into the config as is, so rule definitions should look
like: "PERMS = p+u+g+acl+selinux+xattrs". See docs for defaults.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="conf_checks"></a>`conf_checks`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Directory and file checks. As AIDE parses these from top to
bottom in the config file, the way you order this array matters.
Individual file checks should come before their parent directory
checks. Each check is passed into the config as is, so checks
should look like: "/boot/ CONTENT_EX". See docs for defaults.
If you choose not to use the default values, it is HIGHLY
RECOMMENDED that you ignore the directory /opt/puppetlabs/puppet/cache/
and ignore the file /opt/puppetlabs/puppet/public/last_run_summary.yaml
as these change every Puppet run.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilspackageslinuxlogrotate"></a>`abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::logrotate`

This class is essentially a wrapper around puppet/logrotate

* **See also**
  * https://forge.puppet.com/modules/puppet/logrotate

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::logrotate
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::logrotate` class:

* [`manage_etc_logrotate`](#manage_etc_logrotate)
* [`merge_defaults`](#merge_defaults)
* [`etc_logrotate_settings`](#etc_logrotate_settings)
* [`rules`](#rules)

##### <a name="manage_etc_logrotate"></a>`manage_etc_logrotate`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether or not you want to manage /etc/logrotate.conf.
If you would like this class to also install logrotate,
this must be set to `true`. Default: true

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="merge_defaults"></a>`merge_defaults`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

This class provides a basic config for /etc/logrotate.conf.
If you provide your own configuration and would like to
merge those settings with the default settings, set this
to true. If you choose to merge settings, settings you
define will replace the default setting, if it exists.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="etc_logrotate_settings"></a>`etc_logrotate_settings`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of settings to configure in /etc/logrotate.conf.
This hash is passed directly to the logrotate::conf
defined type.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="rules"></a>`rules`

Data type: `Optional[Hash[String, Hash]]`

Key-value pairs used to create extra logrotate rules.
The keys must be file paths, and the values are hashes
that get passed directly into the logrotate::rule
defined type.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilspackageslinuxrsyslog"></a>`abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::rsyslog`

Installs, configures, and manages rsyslog in an opinionated
manner specific to compliance. If you need more robust rsyslog
management, you should annotate this class as ignored and
implement your own rsyslog solution. Vox Pupuli maintains
an excellent rsyslog module: https://forge.puppet.com/modules/puppet/rsyslog.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::rsyslog
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::rsyslog` class:

* [`tcp_port`](#tcp_port)
* [`logging_conf`](#logging_conf)
* [`remote_log_host`](#remote_log_host)
* [`tcp_log_receiver`](#tcp_log_receiver)

##### <a name="tcp_port"></a>`tcp_port`

Data type: `Optional[Integer]`

The port to use for the $InputTCPServerRun option. Default: 514

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="logging_conf"></a>`logging_conf`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

Key-value pairs of rsyslog logging options.
Default: { '*.emerg' => ':omusrmsg:*',
           'auth,authpriv.*' => '/var/log/secure',
           'mail.*' => '-/var/log/mail',
           'mail.info' => '-/var/log/mail.info',
           'mail.warning' => '-/var/log/mail.warn',
           'mail.err' => '-/var/log/mail.err',
           'news.crit' => '-/var/log/news/news.crit',
           'news.err' => '-/var/log/news/news.err',
           'news.notice' => '/-var/log/news/news.notice',
           '*.=warning;*.=err' => '-/var/log/warn',
           '*.crit' => '/var/log/warn',
           '*.*;mail.none;news.none' => '-/var/log/messages',
           'local0,local1.*' => '-/var/log/localmessages',
           'local2,local3.*' => '-/var/log/localmessages',
           'local4,local5.*' => '-/var/log/localmessages',
           'local6,local7.*' => '-/var/log/localmessages' }

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="remote_log_host"></a>`remote_log_host`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Stdlib::IP::Address, String[1]]]`

A remote host for rsyslog to send logs to.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="tcp_log_receiver"></a>`tcp_log_receiver`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`



Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilspackageslinuxsudo"></a>`abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::sudo`

Manages the sudo package and manages /etc/sudoers.d. Allows you
to configure Defaults in /etc/sudoers and allows you to manage
sudoers via drop-in files.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::sudo
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::sudo` class:

* [`package_ensure`](#package_ensure)
* [`options`](#options)

##### <a name="package_ensure"></a>`package_ensure`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['installed', 'latest', 'absent']]`

Used with the sudo package resource.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Optional[Hash]`

A hash of options for configuring sudo and sudoers.

Options:

* **defaults** `Hash`: Creates Defaults in /etc/sudoers
* **user_group** `Hash`: Creates drop-in sudoer files for users / groups.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilspam_auth"></a>`abide_linux::utils::pam_auth`

Configures password history, password lockout, and password
quality in PAM password-auth and system-auth.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::pam_auth
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::pam_auth` class:

* [`pw_history_module`](#pw_history_module)
* [`lockout_module`](#lockout_module)
* [`pwquality_args`](#pwquality_args)
* [`pam_unix_args`](#pam_unix_args)
* [`pwhistory_args`](#pwhistory_args)
* [`faillock_args`](#faillock_args)
* [`faillock_die_args`](#faillock_die_args)
* [`tally2_args`](#tally2_args)

##### <a name="pw_history_module"></a>`pw_history_module`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['pam_pwhistory.so', 'pam_unix.so']]`

Which PAM module to use for password history configuration.
Default: pam_unix.so

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="lockout_module"></a>`lockout_module`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['pam_faillock.so', 'pam_tally2.so']]`

Which PAM module to use for password lockout configuration.
Default: pam_faillock.so

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="pwquality_args"></a>`pwquality_args`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Arguments for pam_pwquality.so configuration.
Default: [try_first_pass, local_users_only, retry=3, authtok_type=]

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="pam_unix_args"></a>`pam_unix_args`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Arguments for pam_unix.so configuration. If pam_unix.so is selected as
the password history module (the default) then the argument `remember=5`
is added to the default value.
Default: [sha512, shadow, nullok, try_first_pass, use_authtok]

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="pwhistory_args"></a>`pwhistory_args`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Arguments for pam_pwhistory.so configuration. These arguments are
only relevant if you specify pam_pwhistory.so as the password history
PAM module.
Default: [use_authtok, remember=5, retry=3]

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="faillock_args"></a>`faillock_args`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Arguments for pam_faillock.so configuration. These arguments are
only relevant if you specify pam_faillock.so as the password lockout
PAM module (the default).
Default: [preauth, silent, sudit, deny=5, unlock_time=900]

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="faillock_die_args"></a>`faillock_die_args`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Arguments for secondary pam_faillock.so configuration where the control
is `default=die`. These arguments are only relevant if you specify
pam_faillock.so as the password lockout PAM module (the default).
Default: [authfail, audit, deny=5, unlock_time=900]

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="tally2_args"></a>`tally2_args`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Arguments for pam_tally2.so configuration. These arguments are only
relevant if you specify pam_tally2.so as the password lockout PAM
module.
Default: [deny=5, onerr=fail, unlock_time=900]

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsservicessystemdtmp_mount"></a>`abide_linux::utils::services::systemd::tmp_mount`

Enables and configures the tmp.mount service in systemd.
The tmp.mount service is a built-in systemd service that
mounts /tmp with the tmpfs filesystem.

* **See also**
  * https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/filesystems/tmpfs.html

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include abide_linux::utils::services::systemd::tmp_mount
```

##### 

```puppet
class { 'abide_linux::utils::services::systemd::tmp_mount':
  noexec        => true,
  nodev         => true,
  nosuid        => true,
  other_options => ['mode=1777', 'strictatime'],
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::services::systemd::tmp_mount` class:

* [`noexec`](#noexec)
* [`nodev`](#nodev)
* [`nosuid`](#nosuid)
* [`other_options`](#other_options)

##### <a name="noexec"></a>`noexec`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Adds 'noexec' to the tmp.mount unit file options.
Default: true

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="nodev"></a>`nodev`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Adds 'nodev' to the tmp.mount unit file options.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="nosuid"></a>`nosuid`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Adds 'nosuid' to the tmp.mount unit file options.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="other_options"></a>`other_options`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String]]`

Other options to be added to the tmp.mount unit file options.

Default value: ``undef``

## Defined types

### <a name="abideutilsdisable_fs_mounting"></a>`abide_linux::utils::disable_fs_mounting`

Disables filesystem mounting in Linux by creating
a modprobe conf file and running rmmod on the
filesystem. WILL NOT disable vfat if the node
booted from UEFI as UEFI requires vfat.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::disable_fs_mounting { 'filesystem': }
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::disable_fs_mounting` defined type:

* [`filesystem`](#filesystem)

##### <a name="filesystem"></a>`filesystem`

Data type: `String[1]`



Default value: `$title`

### <a name="abideutilsfile_permissions"></a>`abide_linux::utils::file_permissions`

Similar to the permissions aspect of the File resource,
this defined type allows you to set the owner, group,
and mode of a file. This allows for not managing a
file via a file resource, but just setting permissions.
You can also choose to manage only the ownership or
only the permissions mode of the file.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::file_permissions { '/etc/passwd':
  owner => 'root',
  group => 'root',
  mode  => '644',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::file_permissions` defined type:

* [`path`](#path)
* [`manage_ownership`](#manage_ownership)
* [`manage_mode`](#manage_mode)
* [`owner`](#owner)
* [`group`](#group)
* [`mode`](#mode)

##### <a name="path"></a>`path`

Data type: `Stdlib::AbsolutePath`

The path to the file to manage. Defaults to the
resource title if not specified.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="manage_ownership"></a>`manage_ownership`

Data type: `Boolean`

If false, ownership of the file will not be managed.

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="manage_mode"></a>`manage_mode`

Data type: `Boolean`

If false, the mode (permissions) of the file will
not be managed.

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `String[1]`

The user who owns the file.

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="group"></a>`group`

Data type: `String[1]`

The group that owns the file.

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `Pattern[/^[0-7][0-7][0-7]$/]`

The octal permissions for the file. Do not use a leading zero.

Default value: `'755'`

### <a name="abideutilsfstab_entry"></a>`abide_linux::utils::fstab_entry`

Allows you to create, modify, or delete an entry in /etc/fstab.
This defined type is a convienience wrapper around mounttab,
the augeas provider created by Hercules Team. fstab_entry does
not expose all of the options that mountab does, so if you
need more fine-grained control over your fstab entries,
use mounttab directly.

* **See also**
  * https://forge.puppet.com/modules/herculesteam/augeasproviders_mounttab
  * https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Fstab

#### Examples

##### Configuring secure /dev/shm mount for CentOS 7

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::fstab_entry { '/dev/shm':
  device => 'tmpfs',
  fstype => 'tmpfs',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::fstab_entry` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#ensure)
* [`device`](#device)
* [`fstype`](#fstype)
* [`noexec`](#noexec)
* [`nosuid`](#nosuid)
* [`nodev`](#nodev)
* [`options`](#options)
* [`dump`](#dump)
* [`pass`](#pass)
* [`atboot`](#atboot)

##### <a name="ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Enum['present', 'absent']`



Default value: `'present'`

##### <a name="device"></a>`device`

Data type: `String[1]`



Default value: `''`

##### <a name="fstype"></a>`fstype`

Data type: `String[1]`



Default value: `''`

##### <a name="noexec"></a>`noexec`

Data type: `Boolean`

Add the noexec option

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="nosuid"></a>`nosuid`

Data type: `Boolean`

Add the nosuid option

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="nodev"></a>`nodev`

Data type: `Boolean`

Add the nodev option

Default value: ``true``

##### <a name="options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Array[String[1]]`

Other options to add

Default value: `['defaults', 'seclabel']`

##### <a name="dump"></a>`dump`

Data type: `String[1]`



Default value: `'0'`

##### <a name="pass"></a>`pass`

Data type: `String[1]`



Default value: `'0'`

##### <a name="atboot"></a>`atboot`

Data type: `Enum['yes', 'no']`



Default value: `'yes'`

### <a name="abideutilslimits"></a>`abide_linux::utils::limits`

Creates a supplementary limits conf file for setting
security limits configs on Linux machines. This DOES
NOT overwrite the actual /etc/security/limits.conf
file, but instead creates a file in /etc/security/limits.d/.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::limits { 'disable-coredumps':
  priority => '10',
  content  => '* hard core 0',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::limits` defined type:

* [`name`](#name)
* [`owner`](#owner)
* [`group`](#group)
* [`mode`](#mode)
* [`content`](#content)
* [`source`](#source)

##### <a name="name"></a>`name`

Data type: `String`

The resource name is used to create the filename.
The resource name should end in ".conf".

##### <a name="owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `String[1]`

The file's owner.

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="group"></a>`group`

Data type: `String[1]`

The file's group.

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

The file's mode.

Default value: `'0644'`

##### <a name="content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

A string that is passed into the file. Also allows for
templating the file. Mututally exclusive with source.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

A path to a file that will be used as the limits file.
Mutually exclusive with content.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsmodprobe_conf"></a>`abide_linux::utils::modprobe_conf`

By default, this type creates a new `.conf` file in `/etc/modprobe.d`
with the file name being the resource title. It is unnecessary to add
`.conf` to the file name, as it will be appended to the file name
string.

* **See also**
  * https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/6.20/types/file.html

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::modprobe_conf { 'dccp': }
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::modprobe_conf` defined type:

* [`conf_file`](#conf_file)
* [`owner`](#owner)
* [`group`](#group)
* [`mode`](#mode)
* [`basepath`](#basepath)
* [`extension`](#extension)
* [`content`](#content)
* [`source`](#source)

##### <a name="conf_file"></a>`conf_file`

Data type: `String[1]`

A unique name for the config file without a path of file extension

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="owner"></a>`owner`

Data type: `String[1]`

Owner of file

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="group"></a>`group`

Data type: `String[1]`

Owner group of file

Default value: `'root'`

##### <a name="mode"></a>`mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

File permissions mode

Default value: `'0644'`

##### <a name="basepath"></a>`basepath`

Data type: `String[1]`

The path to the modprobe directory

Default value: `'/etc/modprobe.d'`

##### <a name="extension"></a>`extension`

Data type: `String[1]`

The file extension for the new file

Default value: `'.conf'`

##### <a name="content"></a>`content`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The file content. Mutually exclusive with source.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="source"></a>`source`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

The file source. Mutually exclusive with content.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilspackageslinuxsudouser_group"></a>`abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::sudo::user_group`

Creates drop-in files to manage sodoer users and groups. Before
the drop-in file is created, `visudo -c` is ran against the file
to ensure the syntax is correct.

#### Examples

##### Give "admins" group full sudo access with no password

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::sudo::user_group { '%admins':
  options => ['NOPASSWD:'],
}
```

##### Give users test1 and test2 limited sudo access

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::sudo::user_group { 'limited_admin':
  user_group   => ['test1', 'test2'],
  target_users => ['NETWORKING', 'SOFTWARE'],
  commands     => ['/usr/bin/stat', '/usr/sbin/ip'],
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::packages::linux::sudo::user_group` defined type:

* [`user_group`](#user_group)
* [`host`](#host)
* [`target_users`](#target_users)
* [`priority`](#priority)
* [`sudoers_dir`](#sudoers_dir)
* [`commands`](#commands)
* [`options`](#options)
* [`file_name`](#file_name)

##### <a name="user_group"></a>`user_group`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Array[String[1]]]`

The user(s) / group(s) you want to manage. Defaults to the
resource title, however multiple users and groups can be
specified by setting user_group to an Array value. NOTE:
group names MUST be prefixed with a `%` symbol as these
are passed unmodified into the drop-in file.

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="host"></a>`host`

Data type: `String[1]`

Which host to assign in the sudoers statement.

Default value: `'ALL'`

##### <a name="target_users"></a>`target_users`

Data type: `Variant[String[1], Array[String[1]]]`

A user or array of users or user specifications to assign in the sudoers statement.

Default value: `'ALL'`

##### <a name="priority"></a>`priority`

Data type: `Integer`

A numerical prefix added to the drop-in file name.

Default value: `10`

##### <a name="sudoers_dir"></a>`sudoers_dir`

Data type: `Stdlib::UnixPath`

The directory where you want to create the drop-in file.

Default value: `'/etc/sudoers.d'`

##### <a name="commands"></a>`commands`

Data type: `Variant[Enum['ALL'], Array[String[1]]]`

Which commands to assign in the sudoers statement.

Default value: `'ALL'`

##### <a name="options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Optional[Array[String[1]]]`

Options to add to the sudoers statement.

Default value: ``undef``

##### <a name="file_name"></a>`file_name`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

An optional file name. Specifying this will override the dynamically
generated file name. This WILL NOT change the sudoers directory path.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="abideutilsremount_fs"></a>`abide_linux::utils::remount_fs`

remount_fs runs the command /bin/mount -o remount,<options> <title> to
remount the specified file system with the new options.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
abide_linux::utils::remount_fs { '/dev/shm':
  options => ['defaults', 'noexec', 'nodev', 'nosuid'],
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `abide_linux::utils::remount_fs` defined type:

* [`options`](#options)

##### <a name="options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Array[String[1]]`



Default value: `['defaults']`

## Resource types

### <a name="inetd_service"></a>`inetd_service`

inetd_service { 'foo':
  ensure => 'present',
}

This type provides Puppet with the capabilities to manage ...

If your type uses autorequires, please document as shown below, else delete
these lines.
**Autorequires**:
* `Package[foo]`

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `inetd_service` type.

##### `attributes`

Data type: `Array[String]`

The attributes of the service definition.

Default value: `[]`

##### `disable`

Data type: `Boolean`

Marks a service as disabled by adding "disabled = yes" to the service configs

##### `ensure`

Data type: `Enum[present, absent]`

Sets the state of the service. Setting this to disabled means that, if the service exists, it should be explicitly disabled.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `inetd_service` type.

* [`absent_satisfies_disable`](#absent_satisfies_disable)
* [`name`](#name)
* [`source`](#source)

##### <a name="absent_satisfies_disable"></a>`absent_satisfies_disable`

Data type: `Boolean`

If true, the resouce will report disabled even if it is actually absent.

##### <a name="name"></a>`name`

namevar

Data type: `String`

The name of the (x)inetd service you want to manage.

##### <a name="source"></a>`source`

Data type: `String[1]`

The file or files where the service definition should be created.

Default value: `/etc/xinetd.conf`

**Supports noop?** false

#### Parameters

##### `enforce_user_homedir_mode`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to chmod homedir if it's world or group writable

##### `user_homedir_mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

The mode to set a user's homedir to

##### `enforce_user_homedir_ownership`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to chown homedir if not owned by user

##### `create_user_homedir`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not a user should have a homedir created for them if they don't have one

##### `enforce_user_dotfile_mode`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to chmod dotfiles if they are world or group writable

##### `user_dotfile_mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

The mode to set dotfiles to

##### `purge_user_forward_files`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to purge .forward files

##### `purge_user_netrc_files`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to purge .netrc files

##### `enforce_user_netrc_mode`

Data type: `Boolean`

If not purged, whether or not to chmod .netrc files if they are group or world writable

##### `user_netrc_mode`

Data type: `String[1]`

The mode to set netrc files to

##### `purge_user_rhosts_files`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether or not to purge .rhosts files

### <a name="redhat_subscription_manager"></a>`redhat_subscription_manager`

Register a system with RedHat subscription manager

**Supports noop?** false

#### Parameters

##### `username`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Username for account which is registering the system

##### `password`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

user account password

##### `serverurl`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

Another host to register with instead of subscription.rhn.redhat.com

##### `baseurl`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

the name of the content delivery service to configure the yum service to pull down packages

##### `name`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

hostname to register

##### `consumerid`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

existing system inventory id to re-register the system

##### `activationkey`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

comma-separated list of product keys to redeem

##### `auto_attach`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

automatically attaches the best-matched, compatible subscriptions to this system

##### `servicelevel`

Data type: `Optional[Enum[standard, premium, self-support]]`

sets the service level (standard, premium, self-support) to use with subscriptions

##### `force`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

registers the system even if it is already registered

##### `org`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

registers the system to an organization

##### `environment`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

registers the system to an environment within an organization

##### `proxy`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

registers the system via a proxy server

##### `proxyuser`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

If using proxy, the username to use with the proxy

##### `proxypass`

Data type: `Optional[String]`

password for the proxy user
